geneVariantDescriptions.description: BARD1 V695L lies within the BRCT domain 2 of the Bard1 protein (UniProt.org). The functional effect of V695L is conflicting, as it demonstrates homology-directed DNA repair activity similar to wild-type Bard1, but also results in a loss of growth inhibition and apoptosis in cell culture (PMID: 17848578, PMID: 16061562), results in reduced centrosomal amplification and localization of Bard1 in cell culture, demonstrates similar association with Brca1 to wild-type Bard1 in an in-vitro assay (PMID: 29858377), and decreased homology-directed DNA repair activity (PMID: 30925164), and therefore, its effect on Bard1 protein function is unknown.

references.title: BRCA1-Interacting Protein OLA1 Requires Interaction with BARD1 to Regulate Centrosome Number.
Identification and characterization of missense alterations in the BRCA1 associated RING domain (BARD1) gene in breast and ovarian cancer.
Functional analysis of BARD1 missense variants in homology-directed repair and damage sensitivity.
Structural requirements for the BARD1 tumor suppressor in chromosomal stability and homology-directed DNA repair.
